}} 'Adenosine' (ADO) is a purine nucleoside comprising a molecule of adenine
attached to a ribose sugar molecule (ribofuranose) moiety via a Î²-N 9-
glycosidic bond.

Adenosine plays an important role in biochemical processes, such as energy
transferâas adenosine triphosphate (ATP) and adenosine diphosphate (ADP)âas well
as in signal transduction as cyclic adenosine monophosphate, cAMP. It is also an
inhibitory neurotransmitter, believed to play a role in promoting sleep and
suppressing arousal, with levels increasing in the brain with each hour an
organism is awake.
categories: Drugs acting on the cardiovascular system
